roleset.name: turn around, change direction, switch to the opposite direction/state

example.name: typical usage
example.text: The spinoff argument, after all, reverses the current notion that assets are worth more to private buyers than to public shareholders.
example.arg: the current notion that assets are worth more to private buyers than to public shareholders.

example.name: nice reciprocal example
example.text: Mr. Marcus believes spot steel prices will continue to fall through early 1990 and then reverse themselves.

example.name: just arg1
example.text: The company is doing a complete reverse of its previous globalization strategy.

example.name: with beneficiary of reversal
example.text: people, who a little before shuddered at the Roman name, flocked together in crowds to behold their reverse of fortune.

example.name: Both args
example.text: Firefighter's widow reacts to judge's verdict reversal.

roleset.note: REVERSE-V NOTES: VN updated by Julia. Member of Vncls 45.4 (from reverse.01-v)
REVERSE-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on reverse-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls other_cos-45.4. (from reverse.01-n)
REVERSAL-N NOTES: Based on Bolt data. Comparison to reverse.01. Reverse.01 is a member of VN class other_cos-45.4. No FN class. Framed by Katie. (from reversal.01-n)
arg2-beneficiary added based on internet occurance (from reverse.01-n)
